criterion.description: Patient’s phenotype or family history is highly specific for a disease with a single genetic etiology
criterion.shortDescription: Disease specific phenotype and family history

supportingData.explanation:
1.Only ~50% of HCM is genetic (can be caused by environment) 
2. More than 10 genes can cause HCM (specifically 9 sarcomere genes)

author: Steven Harrison
description:
Variant: NM_000257.2(MYH7):c.1822T>G (Leu608Val)

Variant found in a case with clinical diagnosis of hypertrophic cardiomyopathy. However….
Only ~50% of HCM is genetic (can be caused by environment)
More than 10 genes can cause HCM (specifically 9 sarcomere genes)
http://omim.org/phenotypicSeries/PS192600

PP4 not applicable for this variant/condition because HCM does not have a single genetic etiology
